main event: On August 5, 1958, in Ridgefield, Washington, a 5-second ground-radar observation reported a single object following a straight course, resembling characteristics of known aircraft such as #102 or F-86 Oliver's at times & Fireball orbits.
interesting points: The object looked like a little round ball of fire and was slightly larger than a bright star, with a yellowish-white color.
There was no physical evidence found at the location.
Radar operators suggested that the flight path was characteristic of certain known aircraft.
The report mentions concern about one of the three HA-21's in the area, but later, it was accounted for.
The observation took place in clear visibility conditions with 15 miles of visibility and calm winds.
sighted object: single object resembling a little round ball of fire
